3.text: The FCM 50 t is a dangerous Tier VIII French Premium tank.

8.text: This is a fast, maneuverable vehicle with good view range.

17.text: and its gameplay is based on the tank's speed and dynamics, not on its armor.

21.text: The FCM's designation as a heavy tank can be deceptive.

25.text: It is a heavy tank, and it does have a decent pool of 1500 hit points.

30.text: However, if it fights on the front line, it will look something like a figure skater playing ice hockey.

35.text: Its rapid maneuvers may dazzle its opponents for a while, but even the most beautiful breakthrough will most likely…

45.text: So, it's best to leave tanking to the true heavies.

48.text: But why? The FCM is a heavy tank too, isn't it?

53.text: The 120 mm front armor plate and 80 mm side plates can block shots only from lower-tier vehicles.

60.text: You can't count on ricochets. Additionally, the tank is quite big.

64.text: At close range, enemy vehicles can hit it even without taking the time to aim.

69.text: The FCM is an easy and enticing target.

74.text: who know how to use support tactics, will immediately see the potential of the FCM 50 t.

80.text: Support is what this French tank was created for.

83.text: Its good characteristics will make it a pleasure to play.

86.text: Good view range and an accurate gun allow the FCM to fight from a distance.

91.text: Without any crew skills or additional equipment, its view range is 400 meters, and this is the top value in its tier.

98.text: If you mount Coated Optics, and train your crew with the Recon and Situational Awareness skills,

104.text: and the Brothers in Arms perk, you will get an outstanding view range value.

108.text: The FCM can cause damage upon its own spotting while staying undetected.

113.text: For example, the standard view range of the IS-3 is 350 meters.

118.text: So, the French heavy can fire at him from the distance while remaining unpunished.

122.text: Maintaining the distance is key, because the FCM's size will give it away immediately if the enemy gets closer.

128.text: That's why you should use the terrain.

130.text: This tank performs well on hilly maps, thanks to the good elevation and depression angles of its gun.

136.text: The 90 mm armor-piercing shells can penetrate 212 mm of armor,

142.text: giving the FCM the ability to penetrate almost any vehicle it might meet in battle.

147.text: The average damage per shot is 240, a relatively low value.

152.text: Eight shots per minute can produce almost 2,000 damage per minute.

156.text: This is an average value for Tier VIII vehicles,

159.text: but the combination of fast reload and high armor penetration will cause a lot of trouble for the enemy.

165.text: Adding a Gun Rammer and Enhanced Gun-Laying Drive will reduce the reload time and aim time of the gun.

172.text: You can train the Gunner with the Deadeye perk to cause critical damage to the modules of enemy vehicles more often.

179.text: When keeping your distance is not an option, the FCM's excellent dynamics come in handy.

184.text: The FCM is one of the best Premium Tier VIII vehicle in terms of speed and agility.

194.text: It accelerates rapidly, and, thanks to its wide tracks, neither soft ground nor pits and bumps can stop it.

201.text: The hull traverse and turret traverse speeds will be an unpleasant surprise for light tanks that like to circle around heavy tanks.

208.text: You'll definitely want to keep your front armor turned to their shots,

211.text: and the standard 40 degrees per second of hull traverse speed will enable you to do so.

216.text: That traverse speed can be improved by the Clutch Braking skill.

220.text: Adding Improved Ventilation, Strong Coffee, and Gasoline will boost that traverse speed even more.

225.text: The Off-Road Driving skill is not required, as the FCM is already quite good at crossing bogs.

232.text: The FCM's speed allows it to take advantageous positions at the beginning of the battle, spot enemies, and get away with it.

239.text: However, you'd better have a retreat plan, because French armor won't let you hold a position.

246.text: Playing the FCM, you should be prepared to change positions and you definitely shouldn't rush into the thick of the action.

252.text: Your key objectives are to avoid damage, flank the enemy, and attack them stealthily…

261.text: Duels in the city streets and shoot-outs from behind the building corners are dangerous for the FCM

266.text: especially against tanks with high damage per shot.

269.text: However, those wide tracks can save the FCM from taking damage in some cases.

274.text: No, its tracks are not a black hole where shells disappear.

277.text: The chassis is a separate module, so penetrating the tracks doesn't necessarily mean that a tank's hull was hit.

283.text: A shell may pass under the hull.

285.text: Additionally, the FCM's tracks cover almost the whole side, adding 30 mm of armor to the 80 mm side armor.

292.text: So, to penetrate the hull, a shell needs to penetrate 110 mm of armor at a 90 degree angle, and even more at more acute angles.

300.text: Sometimes, the speed and weight of the FCM may entice you to go for ramming.

305.text: But you should remember its thin armor.

307.text: In ramming, many parameters are considered, including the armor of both vehicles.

312.text: So, you shouldn't ram heavy vehicles, but light ones had better stay out of your way.

319.text: The FCM is a vehicle for the tacticians; cunning drivers with experience in medium tanks.

324.text: It can change positions on the map quickly, inflict damage from long range, and ambush the enemy, all while going unpunished.

331.text: Preferential matchmaking makes battle conditions more favorable.

335.text: Cheap shells, huge ammunition capacity, quick rate of fire and good armor penetration will allow you

341.text: to earn a decent amount of credits per battle.

345.text: If you want to learn more about this tank, follow the link to a special website.

352.text: Good luck, and see you on the battlefield!
